title: Can't install League, is the installer broken?
body:
So, I recently factory reset this computer, and I've been reinstalling a bunch of programs. Everything has reinstalled properly except League. When I attempt to launch the installer from the League website, nothing happens. I've tried running as administrator in at least 5 different ways. Only running the installer through Command Prompt as admin will open it. Even then, I get to the installation, and I get a prompt asking, "Are you sure you want to cancel the installation?". It does this over and over and I can't continue with the installation. Is this a problem with the installer, or is my machine the problem? I didn't have problems on this machine before.

Specs:

CPU - Intel Core 2 Duo @ 2.80 GHz

Memory - 4 GB

OS - Windows Vista SP2 32-bit

Graphics - GTX 650

replies.body: You're on the right track, because it sounds like some setting in your OS is blocking the patcher from launching.  In addition to running as admin, there are a few more steps you can try to troubleshoot with through our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide.  Give it a go, and it should get you fixed up!
